{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3499146,"name":"Coach 240","username":"Kerpaul95","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/e9c0ed/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T19:08:27.667Z","cooked":"

I succumb to the bruise on my head from bashing it into this code. We have deployed code to our Rio, but when we connect to the robot, the driver station tells us there’s no robot code on it. The console gives this error over and over on cycle:

Warning ﻿﻿ 16 ﻿﻿ ﻿Warning﻿: Joystick Button 3 missing (max 0), check if all controllers are plugged in ﻿﻿ ﻿﻿﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ ﻿Warning﻿: Joystick Button 3 missing (max 0), check if all controllers are plugged in ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ at frc::ReportErrorV(int, char const*, int, char const*, fmt::v11::basic_string_view, fmt::v11::basic_format_argsfmt::v11::context) + 0x12c [0xb694480c] ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ at + 0x1402a8 [0xb69372a8] ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ at frc::DriverStation::GetStickButton(int, int) + 0x14c [0xb69390d8] ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ at frc2::Trigger::AddBinding(wpi::unique_function<void (bool, bool)>&&) + 0x70 [0xb6f9054c] ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ at frc2::Trigger::OnTrue(frc2::CommandPtr&&) + 0xb4 [0xb6f91288] ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ at RobotContainer::ConfigureBindings() + 0x834 [0x41f84] ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ at RobotContainer::RobotContainer() + 0x1bc [0x424b8] ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ at Robot::Robot() + 0x48 [0x35bdc] ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ at void frc::impl::RunRobot(wpi::priority_mutex&, Robot**) + 0x7c [0x381d8] ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ at int frc::StartRobot() + 0x2c0 [0x38e98] ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ at __libc_start_main + 0x10c [0xb470c624]

I’m at a loss.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T19:09:09.984Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":29,"reads":60,"readers_count":59,"score":162.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484678,"topic_slug":"driver-station-error-no-robot-code","display_username":"Coach 240","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69159,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Coach FRC 240"},"post_url":"/t/driver-station-error-no-robot-code/484678/1","custom_user_title":"Coach FRC 240","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3499254,"name":"Troy Maurer","username":"TMaurer4472","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/ce73a5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T20:36:25.917Z","cooked":"

Hello,
That error message is just a warning that there is not a controller connected to the driverstation and should not be halting any major processes.
It is strange that the driverstation is outputting a console message from the code but saying that the code isn’t there. Could you provide a full screenshot of the driverstation? That would be helpful.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T20:36:25.917Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":25.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484678,"topic_slug":"driver-station-error-no-robot-code","display_username":"Troy Maurer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71158,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/driver-station-error-no-robot-code/484678/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499400,"name":"Coach 240","username":"Kerpaul95","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/e9c0ed/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T22:44:11.939Z","cooked":"

We’ve left our workroom for the weekend, but here is some progress we made before adjorning.

This program started from the Phoenix X swerve drive generator, into which we started to code the robot’s other subsystems. We hadnt had issues with the swerve code itself, so I thought, if it’s yelling at me about a joystick, maybe our operator controller (port 1) was causing some issue I couldn’t see.

I left our subsystem files in, and just commented out the xBox controller calls to the commands, and tried redeploying the swerve code. Driver station read it just fine, robot enabled. Uncommented one of the operator controller’s buttons, deployed- worked fine. So clearly the controllers aren’t having problems, and one of our subsystems is misbehaving. Going to continue on this path on Monday.

Thanks for taking a look.

Kerpaul95:

Uncommented one of the operator controller’s buttons, deployed- worked fine. So clearly the controllers aren’t having problems, and one of our subsystems is misbehaving.

Kerpaul95:

at frc2::Trigger::OnTrue(frc2::CommandPtr&&) + 0xb4 [0xb6f91288]
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ at RobotContainer::ConfigureBindings() + 0x834 [0x41f84]

Look carefully at all the places in RobotContainer::ConfigureBindings that call OnTrue. Most likely there’s a problem with the referenced command like it’s null.

TMaurer4472:

That error message is just a warning that there is not a controller connected to the driverstation and should not be halting any major processes.

There’s three messages there. The first two about joystick buttons don’t cause a crash. But then it shows a stack trace from the program crashing.

There’s three messages there. The first two about joystick buttons don’t cause a crash. But then it shows a stack trace from the program crashing.

Thank you for clearing that up. I was confused and thought it was tracing the warning and not a crash.
